data.title: Imam
meta_keywords: How many sixes did Imam-ul-Haq have?
data.meta_description: Imam-ul-Haq: Pakistan's prodigious cricket talent, nephew of Inzamam-ul-Haq, has made waves in international cricket with his remarkable performances.
data.text:
Domestic Brilliance

Imam-ul-Haq's journey to cricketing stardom began in the domestic circuit, where he showcased his immense talent and potential. In the final of the 2016–17 Quaid-e-Azam Trophy, representing Habib Bank Limited, he exhibited his batting prowess by scoring an exceptional unbeaten double-century. This inning not only highlighted his ability to perform under pressure but also earned him widespread recognition.

His stellar performances continued in the 2017–18 National T20 Cup final while playing for Lahore Blues, where he played a crucial unbeaten knock of 59 runs and was rightfully awarded the man of the match accolade. These performances underscored his versatility across different formats of the game and marked him as a player to watch out for in the future.

Imam-ul-Haq's impact was not limited to the domestic circuit in Pakistan. In July 2022, Somerset signed him to play in the County Championship in England, where he showcased his talent on the international stage.

International Triumphs

Imam-ul-Haq's international career has been nothing short of spectacular, marked by several memorable performances. Making his One Day International (ODI) debut against Sri Lanka in October 2017, he etched his name in the record books by scoring a century, becoming only the second Pakistani to achieve this feat on debut. His elegant stroke play and composure under pressure won him widespread acclaim and established him as a future star of Pakistan cricket.

His Test debut against Ireland in May 2018 further solidified his reputation as a dependable batsman. In his very first Test match, he played a crucial innings, scoring a vital half-century that contributed to Pakistan's victory. His adaptability across different formats of the game showcased his maturity and temperament as a cricketer.

Imam-ul-Haq's exploits in limited-overs cricket are equally impressive. In July 2018, during a bilateral ODI series against Zimbabwe, he and Fakhar Zaman set a new record for the highest opening partnership in ODIs, amassing a staggering 304 runs. His consistency in ODIs was further highlighted when he became the second-fastest player to reach 1,000 ODI runs in January 2019.

His inclusion in Pakistan's squad for the 2019 Cricket World Cup was a testament to his capabilities as a top-order batsman. Throughout the tournament, he exhibited his class, including a remarkable innings of 151 runs against England, which remains the highest individual score by a Pakistani batsman against England in ODIs.

Personal Journey

Beyond the cricket field, Imam-ul-Haq's personal journey adds depth to his narrative. Hailing from a cricketing family, with his uncle Inzamam-ul-Haq being a cricketing legend, Imam-ul-Haq carries forward the legacy with pride and determination. His upbringing in Multan, Punjab, and the influence of his family background have played a significant role in shaping his cricketing career.

As a Syed Sunni Muslim, Imam-ul-Haq values his heritage and roots. His family's migration from Hansi, Punjab Province, British India (now in Haryana, India) during the Partition of India reflects the historical significance intertwined with his personal story.
